conclusion: To determine the acceleration of the particle during the time interval from 1 to 3 seconds, we need to analyze the velocity-time graph.
The slope of the velocity-time graph gives the acceleration. The formula for acceleration a is a = Δv / Δt, where Δv is the change in velocity and Δt is the change in time.
From t = 1 to t = 3 seconds, the velocity changes from 2 m/s to -2 m/s.
The change in velocity Δv is calculated as -2 m/s - 2 m/s = -4 m/s.
The change in time Δt is calculated as 3 s - 1 s = 2 s.
The acceleration a is calculated as a = Δv / Δt = -4 m/s / 2 s = -2 m/s².
The acceleration of the particle during the time interval from 1 to 3 seconds is -2 m/s².
